title: Jurong Group Representation Constituency
text:
The Jurong Group Representation Constituency is a five-member <a href="Group%20Representation%20Constituency">Group Representation Constituency</a> located in the <a href="West%20Region%2C%20Singapore">western</a> area of <a href="Singapore">Singapore</a>. The GRC consists of a large section of <a href="Jurong">Jurong</a>, sections of <a href="Bukit%20Batok">Bukit Batok</a> and areas near <a href="Bukit%20Timah%20Road">Upper Bukit Timah Road</a>. The five divisions of the GRC are <a href="Bukit%20Batok%20East">Bukit Batok East</a>, Jurong Central, <a href="Taman%20Jurong">Taman Jurong</a>, <a href="Jurong%20Spring">Jurong Spring</a> and <a href="Clementi%2C%20Singapore">Clementi</a>. The current MPs are <a href="Tharman%20Shanmugaratnam">Tharman Shanmugaratnam</a>, <a href="Tan%20Wu%20Meng">Tan Wu Meng</a>, <a href="Rahayu%20Mahzam">Rahayu Mahzam</a>, <a href="Shawn%20Huang">Shawn Huang</a> and <a href="Xie%20Yao%20Quan">Xie Yao Quan</a>.
History.
In the <a href="2011%20Singapore%20general%20election">2011 general elections</a>, the Jurong Central and Hong Kah division's population carved to form the new Jurong Spring division, while <a href="Yuhua%2C%20Singapore">Yuhua</a> became a <a href="Yuhua%20Single%20Member%20Constituency">SMC</a> in return. In <a href="2015%20Singaporean%20general%20election">2015</a>, <a href="Bukit%20Batok">Bukit Batok</a> was carved as a <a href="Bukit%20Batok%20Single%20Member%20Constituency">SMC</a> while <a href="Clementi%2C%20Singapore">Clementi</a>, a division under the <a href="West%20Coast%20GRC">West Coast GRC</a>, was absorbed to the ward to maintain its five seats.
The constituency was first contested in the <a href="2001%20Singapore%20general%20election">2001 general election</a> with the <a href="People%27s%20Action%20Party">People's Action Party</a> against the <a href="Singapore%20Democratic%20Party">Singapore Democratic Party</a>. The ward won a <a href="walkover">walkover</a> in 2006 before facing another contest with the <a href="National%20Solidarity%20Party%20%28Singapore%29">National Solidarity Party</a> (2011), <a href="Singaporeans%20First">Singaporeans First</a> (2015) and <a href="Red%20Dot%20United">Red Dot United</a> (2020); however, this GRC has always been held by the <a href="People%27s%20Action%20Party">People's Action Party</a> since its creation in 2001.
The ward was first led by the Minister <a href="Lim%20Boon%20Heng">Lim Boon Heng</a> until his retirement from politics in 2011. After his retirement, new MP <a href="Desmond%20Lee%20%28Singaporean%20politician%29">Desmond Lee</a> has assumed leadership for Jurong GRC, but Lee was transferred to <a href="West%20Coast%20GRC">West Coast GRC</a> in 2020 with three term MP <a href="Ang%20Wei%20Neng">Ang Wei Neng</a>.
Ivan Lim was introduced on 24 June 2020 for the General Elections but withdrew 3 days later following allegations of his past behaviour. He was replaced by <a href="Xie%20Yao%20Quan">Xie Yao Quan</a>.
Town Council.
Jurong–Clementi Town Council is operating under the <a href="Yuhua%20SMC">Yuhua SMC</a>, <a href="Bukit%20Batok%20SMC">Bukit Batok SMC</a> & Jurong GRC.
Members of Parliament.
Ong died on 14 July 2008 due to a heart failure. Following his death, Prime Minister <a href="Lee%20Hsien%20Loong">Lee Hsien Loong</a> announced that there would be no <a href="by-elections">by-elections</a> to fill the position since it was a GRC. His seat (Bukit Batok) was temporary replaced by <a href="Halimah%20Yacob">Halimah Yacob</a> from the nearby Bukit Batok East ward until the <a href="2011%20Singapore%20general%20election">next election in 2011</a>, where he was succeeded by <a href="David%20Ong">David Ong</a>.
